data.name: title
data.content: Factors and Multiples

data.name: subtitle
data.content: Understanding numbers from two sides

data.name: title
data.content: What are Factors?

data.name: para
data.content: A factor is a number that divides another number completely, leaving no remainder.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Factors divide a number exactly

data.name: bullet
data.content: They are always finite in number

data.name: bullet
data.content: Every number has at least two factors

data.name: title
data.content: Example: Factors of 12

data.name: para
data.content: The factors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 12 because each divides 12 exactly.

data.name: title
data.content: What are Multiples?

data.name: para
data.content: A multiple is obtained by multiplying a number by whole numbers.

data.name: bullet
data.content: Multiples are formed by repeated multiplication

data.name: bullet
data.content: They increase as we move forward

data.name: bullet
data.content: They do not end

data.name: title
data.content: Example: Multiples of 12

data.name: para
data.content: Some multiples of 12 are 12, 24, 36, 48, and so on.

data.name: left
data.content:
Factors
Divide the number
Finite in count
Found by division

data.name: right
data.content:
Multiples
Multiply the number
Infinite
Found by multiplication

data.name: title
data.content: Why Factors and Multiples Matter

data.name: para
data.content: These ideas help us understand prime numbers, HCF, and LCM in later chapters.
